fields.description: Complete magic search work done in GUI-1373 spike. Complete refactoring and clean up css.
fields.summary: Magic Search to replace filter forms

comments.body:
GREAT job so far! magic search bar notes (discussed in mtg with team on 12/11)

1) change search icon to filter, place it left (done and using filter icon, not mag glass)
2) don't close facet display (wrapping in gray box with X) in bar until value is chosen (style plain in bar until facet and value are chosen) (done)
3) get rid of visible text entry box inside field (at least so I can't see it) (done)
4) wrap/expand box height on lots of facets, leave expanded once all the facets are chosen
5) filter facet list as you type (highlight typed string in facets) (done)
6) make it so you can click anywhere in the filter box instead of that small area. Whole box should be live. (done)

The issue that still exist are:
 - input field is not auto-sizing as I would like. I would like it to start large enough for placeholder text, but auto-size with typed text.
 - If space is used up, the bar should expand vertically to hold the facets/input field, but that isn't working properly.

That's all I know of right now. (cc [~kgill])

It wasn't listed, but using window.history.pushState(...) to update URL and cause ajax reload without refreshing the entire page. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/API/DOM/Manipulating_the_browser_history#The_pushState()_method
http://youtu.be/FTjqFddBJBA

Testing the search bar (can be done on most pages, but images or instances would be good choices):
 - verify that clicking anywhere on the searchbar will bring up the facet menu and set focus to the text field
 - press <esc> to dismiss the menu and test that clicking outside the searchbar also dismisses the menu
 - type into the field. Verify that if you type text that is part of a facet name, that text is bolded in the menu and that selections are reduced based on what matches
 - select a facet and verify that it now appears in plain text followed by a colon (\:). Also see that a new menu appears with facet options and that the text field has focus.
 - select an option and see that the complete facet now appears enclosed in a grey box with an X to the right. Also notice the X to the far right on the search box. Try both of these to remove the facet.
 - verify as you add a facet that the table is refreshed (not the entire page).
 - start typing and enter something that isn't in a facet. See that the table filters live. Press enter and notice a new "text" facet appears
 - type again so that there are no facet matches and backspace. verify that the facet menu appears again once there are matches.
 - type to narrow menu to a single facet and press <tab>. Verify that the facet was selected.
 - type to narrow the options and press <tab>. Verify that the facet is now completed and the table refreshes.
 - verify that at any time, if you've selected a partial facet or option that pressing <esc> will clear that selection.
 - verify that if focus is on the input field without a facet menu that pressing <space> will show the facet menu.
 - select multiple search facets and save the URL. Verify that pasting that URL into a new tab will restore the same view (except for text facets).

I noticed an issue where some key presses cause the facet list to dismiss and a textSearch event to be generated containing something that filters out all of the results. The effect is that users see no records and don't have a way to get them back without refreshing. I think filtering the characters we respond to and ignoring the rest is important. Perhaps limiting values in "textSearch" events to being visible characters would help as well.

Hi [~dkavanagh], are you saying that pressing certain keys other than return or enter causes the text search to run? We should definitely avoid that if we can. 

Deleting the facet with the weird text in it doesn't bring back the results from other facets?
This is a weird case where an event is fired, but no facet is created due to "live filtering". I just need to limit what's accepted for filtering character.
Cool, sounds great. Thank you!

I also identified another minor issue. We'd like to remove facet values that are already selected. When we refreshed the entire page, they would be removed at initialization. Now, without page refresh, the new facet values aren't being removed, so I need to get that working with a small refactoring of that "facet/value culling code".

[~dkavanagh]: I noticed a wrapping issue when the search input was set to a fixed width of 280px, but removing that cuts off the placeholder text.  Should we try to shorten the placeholder text to fix in the smaller search input?

[~kgill], The text input size issue is one I was hoping you could help with. Notice how it works here: http://documentcloud.github.io/visualsearch/
They seem to have the box auto-size and starts out at 3 pixels wide. I'm not sure how they got that working. They don't use placeholder text either, so we may want to talk to [~jloza] about the options there. We could "fake" placeholder text if we get the auto-sizing input working. We could simply display some text in the facet area when there are no facets. Notice there are a couple places in the javascript where I clear out the placeholder text if facets are created.
OK, I've fixed the bugs I know of.
I'd like to keep the placeholder text, please. We could look at shortening it. but there's probably a different problem here that needs fixing.

I've noticed the following issues with the magic_search branch...
- The "live search" (i.e. filter as you type) feature is missing or broken
- Filtering by tags is busted
- Filtering by roles is busted (tested on Instances landing page)
- The Selenium tests will need to be updated, since a few of those assume the left column filters are still there
- The Jasmine tests will need to be updated (Travis is failing on every commit in the branch)
I've seen live search working on FF and Chrome. testing the others now.

Commit http://git.io/1Fga3w seems to fix the live search, but it still chokes on hyphen characters.  Also, the results aren't restored when the live search input is cleared via the backspace/delete key

[~kgill], i just tested role filtering (after starting an instance with a role) and it filtered down to that single instance as expected. I've fixed the other issues except for selenium, which I'll tackle next.
[~dkavanagh]: Did you test filtering by roles when no roles are present?
Yes, and no instances showed, so then I started an instance with a role.

[~dkavanagh]: Hmm, filtering by tags and roles still displays an empty dropdown.  Anything we can do to fix that?  
Also, filtering by roles still seems broken, but maybe it's when I try a filter when there are no roles.  I'm wondering if there's still work to be done there to improve how we handle empty filter choices.

I see the role name in the dropdown, like other facet options.
I noticed the empty dropdown for the tags, and thought I might get a fix in for that. I just haven't yet.
Any luck with the layout? It's still a little "loose". Maybe get with Jenny to see what she wants tweaked.

The menu was trying to show for tags only because of the click listener on the search-bar. I changed the logic in that listener so that the menu is only shown on click if no facet is selected. This changes the behavior if we're in the middle of a facet (about to enter an option, or select from the menu).

Creating a new branch to clean up un-used code to support old filters and any other re-factoring to clean things up.

Also, look at ELB landing page wireframe for the way landing pages should look w/ magic-search.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1321

Getting there!

* watermark text background blocks keyline on launch wizards select image panel
* Can you make it so when I remove a facet, it doesn't drop the facet menu automatically? When I have updated my facets, I want to see the list fully, then decide if I need to remove more. (I think I will also want this behavior on adding facets, don't immediately drop the list once I've added one, let me see the results fully, and down arrow or click to get the list, but I want to verify the with design validation user testing. On removal, for sure though). 
* watermark text should include "to search" at the end, any compelling reason why that's not there? It's important, and balances the "to filter" part at the beginning to show why someone would enter text vs select a facet (which BTW should be "to filter" not "for filter") (done)
* TAGS should be a non-selectable header and have the tag keys under it, then values for the selected key populate. The way it is, they are not any more useful than a full text search. Let me know if you can do that, also they should always be the last item in the list (instance page they are in the middle. Also, there's a gray line visible now when you get to tag value entry, and you cann't delete out of the tag: facet until you type a value
*   VPC-related facets should be hidden unless cloud is VPC-enabled (or AWS) (need to test API responses.. maybe)
* volume status values do not include all possible attachment statuses (done)
* scope facet for EIP does not make sense since the cloud will be either standard or VPC, you can get rid of that one (I'll fix the wireframe when I create it) (done)
* launch config list does not match what's in wireframe, please let me know if there's reasons we can't display all those options (done)
* no facets seem to be displaying for IAM users. Please advise (what should I use? nm, found this! https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Landing+page+header+info)
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1332

I think I've taken care of everything except the tags facets. I realized that I may not ever get a complete view of the tags that server-side filtering can use, just the tags available in the already filtered data. That's not great, so I left it out for now.

* filter icon no longer vertically aligned in box, sits too low to bottom
* watermark text still blocks keyline on launch wizards
* i clicked the bar on the instances page, with a facet applied, and the drop down seems to drop over to the right mire than id expect. Why is it not dropping down directly below where i click?
* removing facet, menu is still dropped.
* still seeing tags in list
* order of items in facet list does not match wireframe
* I don't think those are the right volume statuses, we shoudl be showing volume attachment statuses. We can show finer granularity w/r/t volume attachment other than in use and available. [~viglesias] can confirm. see wireframe at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Landing+page+header+info for what i think we should be able to show.
* still no facets displaying for iam users. 
* also, CSS: keyline and icon should be mid-gray, not black, please.

Please verify things work prior to resubmitting for review, thanks!

copying from jmolo e-mail "the reorged landing page header, the sort menu is wrapping. We need to fix that. Can maybe reduce padding some in big buttons to make room to give it another column if you need to."

The dropdown alignment may be a Foundation bug. I'll look for a workaround: (I found this on-line)
"+1. I have also just upgraded to 5.2 from 5.0 and now find the automatic alignment of dropdowns is now broken. This is a critical problem - with a button on the right of the screen the dropdown is mostly off screen."
https://github.com/zurb/foundation/issues/4619
[~dkavanagh]: I'm confused about your statement "I have also just upgraded to 5.2 from 5.0." According to GUI-1478, we're now on Foundation 5.5.  Was that a typo?
As I mentioned "I found this on-line". (follow the link if you want to see it in context)

[~dkavanagh]: Ah, got it.  So recent versions of Foundation no longer support right-aligned drop-downs?  Interesting that the right-aligned example at http://foundation.zurb.com/docs/components/dropdown.html doesn't work.
[~dkavanagh]: nm my last comment, I read the entire comment thread and now I understand the issue.
The last workaround in that thread worked for me.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1368

[~jloza], is there a ticket for the landing page header stuff?
At this point, let's review this stuff together. It's been so long, I'm having a hard time tracking what's left. At this point, what I know about are these:
 - chrome/ff spacing differences which include vertical placement of icons, input and facets.

[~dkavanagh], there's no separate ticket for the header stuff, since it was redesigned as part of tightening things up for the MSB (i.e. as part of this ticket)...let me pull the branch and see how things look and then let's screen share and go over things.

Items from review w/ Jenny
 - magic-search border should be $euca-lightgrey #ccc (done)
 - input box cutting off placeholder text on landing and wizard pages (done)
 - input box focus color is #fafafa, should be white (done)
 - if entering option, delete key in empty input should clear entire entry (esc does it) (done)
 - IAM user.. look at client filtering for lazy-loaded data

After looking into the client-side search, I have to say the complexity will have a cost. Managing a mixture of server/client facets and text filtering is a lot more complicated than I'd like it to be. By re-using the landing page common-code, I can't simply replace server-side filtering with client-side for that one page.
wow! one other thing... flexbox stuff looks like crap on Safari (6.1.6... that's ok.. need to update my safari to 7 or 8)
GUI-1726 and GUI-1727 were written about outstanding issues. Code is in GUI-1472 branch.

almost there! 

* delete key (and backspace I guess, either delete key on a mac keyboard) isn't backing me out. I've chosen a facet and then the values are dropped down. I want to delete out of that and nothing is happening. Delete should work like ESC does here, please. 
* watermark text white area is still overlapping bottom keyline on launch instance wizard.

[~jloza], I know the delete was working. Let me do some more cross-browser test. On the launch instance wizard, I never attempted to fix that since Kamal had some tweak for that. I'll go look into it.
I fixed those 2 issues and made it look good on safari also (no mean feat).

UX review passed, yay! Great job, [~dkavanagh].

Ready for code review.
Punting back to [~dkavanagh] for PEP8 cleanup
I rebased and merged it once travis-ci passed.
PR 1368 merged

I verified the search bar is working and I no longer see the filter options.
